text.p: Shares of STAR Telecommunications Inc and Racing Champions Corp rose as they made their market debuts after their initial public offerings, although they were largely overshadowed by hype surrounding Polo Ralph Lauren Corp RL.N.
STAR Telecommunications jumped 25 percent, rising 2-1/4 to 11-1/4 from an IPO price of $9 a share.

The Santa Barbara, California company provides international long-distance service on a wholesale basis, primarily to U.S.-based long-distance carriers. The company's lead venture capital backer was Gotel Intestments Ltd.

Of the four million shares sold, STAR sold 3.75 million and shareholders sold 250,000. Underwriters Hambrecht & Quist and Alex. Brown & Sons Inc have an option to buy up to an additional 600,000 shares to cover over-allotments, if any.

Racing Champions, which filed to go public in February, rose to 15-5/8 from its IPO price of $14 a share. The price was the high end of price talk of $12 to $14. The Glen Ellyn, Ill., company makes small replicas of automobiles. It sold five million shares in the offering, raising $70 million.
